paragraphs.body: An air temple, or airbender temple, is a large ${link_0} that was formerly inhabited by ${link_1} prior to the ${link_2}, though some also later came to be home to people from other nations. The temples are typically ${link_3} in isolated and difficult-to-reach environments, such as mountaintops or islands. There are five known temples to date, of which one was completely destroyed in 171 ${link_4}.
paragraphs.text: An air temple, or airbender temple, is a large structure that was formerly inhabited by Air Nomads prior to the Air Nomad Genocide, though some also later came to be home to people from other nations. The temples are typically located in isolated and difficult-to-reach environments, such as mountaintops or islands. There are five known temples to date, of which one was completely destroyed in 171 AG.
The Southern Air Temple was restored by 170 AG.

The temple also contains a statue of Monk ${link_7} and was the last known residence of the ${link_8} species. It was restored to its former glory by the ${link_9} after the end of the Hundred Year War.
paragraphs.text: The Southern Air Temple is located in the Patola Mountain Range and was one of two temples that exclusively housed male Air Nomads before the beginning of the Hundred Year War. It was notable for being the home of Avatar Aang. It features an airball arena and an inner sanctuary that houses numerous statues of past Avatars. The temple also contains a statue of Monk Gyatso and was the last known residence of the winged lemur species. It was restored to its former glory by the Air Acolytes after the end of the Hundred Year War.

paragraphs.text: The Northern Air Temple was restored by 171 AG and became home to a new generation of airbenders.

paragraphs.body: The Northern Air Temple was located in the mountains along the northern coast of the ${link_0} and was one of the two temples that exclusively housed male Air Nomads. Prior to the Air Nomad Genocide, it also served as the location of the bison polo championship. Years after the devastating blow the ${link_1} had dealt to the Air Nomads, the deserted temple was colonized by a group of Earth Kingdom ${link_2}, led by a renowned inventor, after their town was destroyed in a flood. The ${link_3} modified the temple to make life easier for the new inhabitants. The temple once held statues and paintings; however, these and other parts of the temple were destroyed by the mechanist to make room for his new technology. The temple returned to its more traditional appearance after it was restored by the ${link_4} after the end of the Hundred Year War, though it was destroyed in 171 AG when ${link_5} used his ${link_6} to melt the foundations.
paragraphs.text: The Northern Air Temple was located in the mountains along the northern coast of the Earth Kingdom and was one of the two temples that exclusively housed male Air Nomads. Prior to the Air Nomad Genocide, it also served as the location of the bison polo championship. Years after the devastating blow the Fire Nation had dealt to the Air Nomads, the deserted temple was colonized by a group of Earth Kingdom refugees, led by a renowned inventor, after their town was destroyed in a flood. The mechanist modified the temple to make life easier for the new inhabitants. The temple once held statues and paintings; however, these and other parts of the temple were destroyed by the mechanist to make room for his new technology. The temple returned to its more traditional appearance after it was restored by the Air Acolytes after the end of the Hundred Year War, though it was destroyed in 171 AG when Ghazan used his lavabending to melt the foundations.

paragraphs.text: The Eastern Air Temple is shrouded high in the clouds.

paragraphs.body: The Eastern Air Temple is located in a mountain range in the southeastern Earth Kingdom and was one of the two temples that exclusively housed female Air Nomads. The site includes many statues of Avatar ${link_0}. After the Air Nomads were killed, the temple became the home of Guru ${link_1}, who taught Avatar Aang how to unlock his ${link_2} and gain mastery of the ${link_3}. It is notable for being situated on three separate mountains, connected by bridges and was the place where all young airbenders would choose the ${link_4} that would become their life companions. According to ${link_5}, it is the most spiritual of all air temples.
paragraphs.text: The Eastern Air Temple is located in a mountain range in the southeastern Earth Kingdom and was one of the two temples that exclusively housed female Air Nomads. The site includes many statues of Avatar Yangchen. After the Air Nomads were killed, the temple became the home of Guru Pathik, who taught Avatar Aang how to unlock his chakras and gain mastery of the Avatar State. It is notable for being situated on three separate mountains, connected by bridges and was the place where all young airbenders would choose the flying bison that would become their life companions. According to Tenzin, it is the most spiritual of all air temples.

paragraphs.body: The ${link_0} is unique from its counterparts in ${link_1}.
paragraphs.text: The Western Air Temple is unique from its counterparts in construction and design.

paragraphs.body: The Western Air Temple is located in the mountains north of the Fire Nation and was one of the two temples that exclusively housed female Air Nomads. Like the Eastern Air Temple, it boasts statues of Yangchen. The temple is notable in that, unlike the other three temples, it is situated underneath the edge of a cliff instead of atop a mountain. The spires seem as though they were built upside-down, and because of that, the temple is hidden from passersby. The site is also decorated with many flying bison paintings that have remained in relatively good condition, unlike those in the Northern Temple. Renowned as the birthplace of past Avatar Yangchen, Avatar Aang and ${link_0} later made it their temporary home in the later stages of the War.
paragraphs.text: The Western Air Temple is located in the mountains north of the Fire Nation and was one of the two temples that exclusively housed female Air Nomads. Like the Eastern Air Temple, it boasts statues of Yangchen. The temple is notable in that, unlike the other three temples, it is situated underneath the edge of a cliff instead of atop a mountain. The spires seem as though they were built upside-down, and because of that, the temple is hidden from passersby. The site is also decorated with many flying bison paintings that have remained in relatively good condition, unlike those in the Northern Temple. Renowned as the birthplace of past Avatar Yangchen, Avatar Aang and his friends later made it their temporary home in the later stages of the War.

paragraphs.text: Air Temple Island is located off the coast of Republic City and is home to Tenzin and his family.

paragraphs.body: Air Temple Island is the most recent air temple, built by Avatar Aang himself, and is home to Tenzin and his family. Located off the coast of ${link_0} near the entrance of ${link_1}, the tides and its coastal geography keep it secluded from casual access. The island sports several structures, including a large tower and a smaller building nearby, and it is inhabited by some sky bison and a different species of flying lemur, the ${link_2}.
paragraphs.text: Air Temple Island is the most recent air temple, built by Avatar Aang himself, and is home to Tenzin and his family. Located off the coast of Republic City near the entrance of Yue Bay, the tides and its coastal geography keep it secluded from casual access. The island sports several structures, including a large tower and a smaller building nearby, and it is inhabited by some sky bison and a different species of flying lemur, the ring-tailed winged lemur.
